author: Mark W. Sanchez
title: Crying Mets fan calls cold Mike Francesa for comfort
text:
There are bad decisions, and then there is calling Mike Francesa for a shoulder to cry on.
That’s the mistake poor Will in Queens made on Sunday, a day after the Mets’ playoff hopes — and possibly Ruben Tejada’s career — were derailed by a disputed slide by Chase Utley that helped the Dodgers take Game 2, 5-2, and even a heated NLDS.
Will explores masochism in an emotional plea to the Mets, through Francesa, to shred these “dirty” Dodgers, imploring Matt Harvey, Monday’s Game 3 starter, to take back control of the series.
“This is his one chance,” Will begins on WFAN, a slight crack to his voice. “Put your team on your shoulders and then you got my faith back in you.”
Will couldn’t keep it up much longer, his voice fading and straining to keep it all together. “He has to do it tomorrow night. I want to see it done tomorrow night. Thank you.”
Of course, seeking comfort from Francesa is seeking McDonald’s for your new diet. It’s not going to help.
“Will, you crying?” an incredulous Francesa, ever the charmer, offers. “Not really crying over this I hope, jeez. … That sounded scary. Will, come on. Calm down, it’s Sunday morning. He’ll be all right, jeez.”
